metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8275 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
OpenSSL before 0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k does not enforce certain constraints on certificate data, which allows remote attackers to defeat a fingerprint-based certificate-blacklist protection mechanism by including crafted data within a certificate's unsigned portion, related to crypto/asn1/a_verify.c, crypto/dsa/dsa_asn1.c, crypto/ecdsa/ecs_vrf.c, and crypto/x509/x_all.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Antti Karjalainen, Tuomo Untinen and Konrad Kraszewski

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu10').
